text.tspan: containers that run on the farm or
in which an experiment ran at
a later date, or on some other
Minimal dependence on underlying hardware and software
- Greater tolerance to new versions of software, changes in
- Allows for more flexibility in taking advantage of new
- Potential to carry out processing on commodity clouds/single
Encapsulate and record the full runtime
- Capture data about input sources, processing, outputs generated.
- Profile jobs based on knowledge of input data and workflow details.
- Accurately estimate our future requirement for compute resources.
- Potential to optimize jobs based on the knowledge of similar
- Difficult to guarantee replicability of experiments due to
implicit dependencies on the underlying stack.
- Faculty would like to be able to report a full and accurate
description of how processed results are generated.
- Experiments are fragile - changes in the underlying stack
can cause them to fail, or change the results transparently.
- Hard to understand the impact of bugs/software changes
since changes cannot be isolated from each other.
- No way of automating manual pipelines without explicit
- No real way to accurately estimate resource requirements
for submitted jobs and/or future invocations of the pipeline.
- Wish to be able to take advantage of commodity processing
Employ cryptographic guarantees of processing stack and data.
- Guarantee the integrity of capsules before processing.
- Support encryption to protect access to confidential data.
- Integrate with external authentication and authorization systems.
- Suitable to work with some confidence on external computing resources.
- Single capsule catalogue supporting lightweight versioning.
- Push as much as possible into environment builds.
- Stage inputs and outputs through gateway recording provenance.
- Filesystem built by CERN to distribute experiment software.
- Designed to be high performance and easy to access across
- FUSE module connecting to repository served over HTTP.
- Software is stored and indexed by file hashes - multiple
versions of software will result in only a single copy of shared
- Employs caching and load-on-demand to reduce network load, and can benefit
Capsules provide the full software stack for running an experiment.
- Pre-built for different projects or pipelines.
- Environments are immutable - only new versions are created.
- Full provenance recorded down to source code.
- Explicit warnings for binary blobs or other places where we cannot trace
Environments are constructed by us or projects in such a way as to record the full
- Start with a minimal template (Currently based on Arch Linux.)
- Use source package builds to construct all software inside the container.
- Wrapper scripts to support easy versioning.
- Use iRods for backing storage of templates and environments?
- Package project software into Arch packages.
Lightweight containerisation approach protects the environment from the
host (and vice versa) with minimal performance penalty.
- Current planning is based on LXC (Linux containers).
- Memory and CPU isolated from the host, but runs in same kernel.
- No virtualization, so no CPU performance penalty.
- Ability to quota memory, CPU, disk access per container.
Also considered: UML (too slow), OpenVZ/Linuz VServer (being phased out),
full virtualisation (hopefully still an option using the same environment).
Control data input and output; explicitly stage in required resources.
- By default, only limited chroot is visible.
- Explicitly define required input resources on a per-file or per-directory
basis and bind mount into the container.
- Pipelines can explicitly state their requirements beforehand; encourage
users to limit their requests (e.g. not requesting all of /scratch/lustre10x).
- Use inotify hooks to gather statistics on the usage of staged-in
- /sys/fs/cgroups filesystem naturally records details of CPU/memory/
- Cloning and running LXC containers both require root privileges.
- Will need to have something running under sudo or setuid on the farm nodes.
- Need to investigate fast way to run LXC container from CVMFS by multiple
- Haven't yet evaluated performance accessing bind-mounted lustre.
- Kernel is still shared, so underlying changes could still impact.
- Need to support FUSE mounting on Farm nodes (should already be there).
